title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. Steps To Reproduce: 1. Start WSWB and create a new project. 2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. 3. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select 'Shut Down...' command to shutdown/reboot the computer.  Results: There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s), the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately. Other Windows programs (like Word, Outlook etc.
EB: When the user attempts to shut down the system while there are unsaved changes in the WSWB project, a warning or question message box should appear to give the users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR: To reproduce: 1. Perform the steps mentioned in the 'Steps To Reproduce' section. 2. Attempt to shut down the computer while the WSWB session with the opened dirty .txt file is still active. Note the absence of a warning or question message box and the immediate shutdown/reboot of the system.
